metadata.title: CVE-2023-0767 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
An attacker could construct a PKCS 12 cert bundle in such a way that couldallow for arbitrary memory writes via PKCS 12 Safe Bag attributes beingmishandled. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 110, Thunderbird < 102.8,and Firefox ESR < 102.8.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-0767` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

libnss3 - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.16
libnss3-tools - 2:3.35-2ubuntu2.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '110.0+build3-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
thunderbird package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.8.0+build2-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
mozjs38: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
mozjs52: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
nss package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.35-2ubuntu2.16').
